author: Kara O'Neill
title: Mortified mother emails son's school to say she's 'keeping him off' but auto-correct sends VERY rude message
text:
Angela and her son Louis (Photo: Mercury) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A mum was left mortified after she tried to email her son's school to tell them she was keeping him off - and instead sent a very rude message. 
Anglea Kovacs contacted her son Louis's head of year to explain that he would be absent on Tuesday after suffering an allergic reaction at the dentist the previous day. 
But autocorrect on her iPhone meant that instead of 'keeping her son off', Angela wrote that she was 'jerking him off' instead, leaving Angela scrambling to send an apology for her x-rated mishap. 
Louis, 11, woke up with a swollen face after having a tooth removed on Monday and was in too much pain to attend classes. 
Angela's email to Park High School in Colne, Lancashire read: "Hi I'm just letting you know that Louis had a reaction to the anaesthetic from having teeth out yesterday. Louis was being kept off school after suffering an allergic reaction at the dentist (Photo: Mercury) 
"I'm jerking him off because I need to keep an eye on him and give him antihistamine regularly. Hopefully he will be back tomorrow. Thanks." 
Angela, 44, from Barrowford, Lancashire, said: "I've never been so embarrassed. I was rushing around trying to look after him and I'd not checked what was written. 
"I was absolutely mortified. I wrote it in a hurry and I'm blaming autocorrect and fat thumbs. 
"By the time I'd realised what I'd done, they'd already replied but didn't acknowledge it. 
"I didn't read it back before I sent it. Once I spotted the mistake I didn't know whether to laugh or cry. 
"The teacher replied saying not to worry, it was fine, but she didn't point out the mistake. She was probably just trying to be polite. The embarrassing message (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) 
"I could have died. I sent a message back just to explain myself, correct it, and say sorry. Predictive text has a lot to answer for. 
"I couldn't have written anything worse." 
Angela, who has another son, eight-year-old Bailey, soon got another response from the school telling her 'not to worry'. Read More Awkward auto-correct fails will make you triple-check every text you send from now on The school appeared to completely ignore Angela's embarrassing autocorrect mistake (Photo: Mercury) 
But as if that embarrassment wasn't enough, Angela had to attend a parents' evening on Thursday and come face-to-face with the teacher she emailed. 
Angela said: "I was dreading it. I think they'd all had a bit of a giggle about it, as did I to be fair. It's easily done. 
"I've had people asking my why the word 'jerking' was even prompted and I don't really have an answer. 
"Louis was at the dentist the night before and he has some allergy problems anyway so I think he's just had a bit of a reaction to something. Louis ready to go back to school (Photo: Mercury Press and Media Ltd) Read More The most cringe-worthy sexts ever sent â€“ from a weird mum to a 'hairy Russian' 
"He's allergic to latex but I phoned ahead and told the dentist that and they took precautions so as not to use latex gloves. 
"It's the first time he's had a tooth out and he was in a lot of pain, but the swelling's gone down now and he'll be back at school this week. 
"Hopefully the teachers don't think any less of me because of it." 
No-one from the school was available for comment. Like us on Facebook
